text: Very hazy yellow. Aroma is dank, some citrus, very green and herbal. Slight grassy notes on the tongue, other than that, another high abv IPA that feels like a session beer. Superb
Can sample at a tasting at troubles place. Thanks Alon. Cloudy yellow. Fruity and green hops, dry, moderately bitter, a bit of hoppy spiciness in the throat. Good.

At a tasting, thanks, smallish creamy head, intense murky yellow color with orange hues, aroma of citrus and flowers with some mustard, shrubby flavor with onion, light fruity sweetness in the back, not too heavy. Nice and enjoyable.

Can shared. Thanks John at Gam! Pours a hazy straw color with a finger of creamy foam. Tons of fruit: white grapefruit, mandarin, white peach, and melon. Creamy on the palate with a full-flavor, more fruit. Lingering creaminess and fruit on the palate. Lots of stone fruit and summer melon. Awesome.
At Drors place, pours yellow hazy with a nice head, aroma of fruits, lemon, lemon skin, flavor is bitter with lemon skin, green, grass, medium bodied

16oz can. Pours hazy pale gold with a moderate white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, nectarine, white grape, and peach. Taste is grapefruit, initially, quickly turning into apricot, peach, citrusy zest, and grass. Light malt presence. Very light pine. Sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body. Medium carbonation - approaching lively. Soft, pillowy mouthfeel.

Can from Trillium. Typically hazy yellow appearance with a lazy messy white head. Aroma is juicy AF, peach, pineapple, orange, white grape. Flavor has some juicy fruity sweetness balanced by a considerable citrus and tropical hop blast, medium bitterness. Medium plus bodied, well carbonated, easy drinking despite the ABV and hoppiness. Great!
16oz can. Murky golden with a frothy white head. Flavors are cereals, pineapple, melon and peach with dank and grassy notes. Medium body, soft to moderate carbonation, smooth texture.
Pours a hazy burnt yellow/orange. Great to look at. Nose is peach, mango, tangerine, sweet citrus. Taste is tropical fruit, citrus, mango, peach, white wine, mandarine. Delicious

Can dated 27/3/17 so a month old. However once cracked the aromas pile out,peach,citrus herbal notes, pulpy orange goodness in a glass, sticky lacing from a small finger of foam.
Tastes of white wine,peaches,pepper and clementines.Smooth bitterness, dry with only a light touch of alcohol. 
Trillium for grown ups!
Aroma frutado, frutas amarelas maduras, corpo médio aveludado, álcool aparente mas bem inserido. Médio dulçor, lúpulo fica mais potente com a temperatura.

Murky yellow color out of the bottle with a quickly shrinking off white head. Candied citrus peel nose. Strong citrus hop flavors with Mandarin orange, tangerine, red grapefruit, stone fruit, tropical fruit and white grapes. Firm malty backbone and a long dry grassy finish. Another big hop juice beer from Trillium.

Bottle... Murky pear-colored pour with a small, creamy, white head. Fantastic retention. The aroma is nasty marriage of nail polish remover and funky armpit with undercurrents of grapefruit and passionfruit. Medium to full-bodied and astringent with lazy carbonation. Bittersweet (more bitter than sweet) and bone-fucking-dry. Lingering, tongue-numbing bitterness. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!
Can shared by a friend. Opaque orange pour with a thick off-white head. Aroma of malt, tropical fruit and citrus. Malty and piney flavor with a grassy hop finish.

En canette. Orangé trouble, fine mousse tenace. Arômes dominant dagrumes, orange, pamplemousse. Goût très gazonné et fruité, pamplemousses, pêches. Une finale amère mais avec un kick dagrumes qui remonte avant de laisser place à une douce amertume résiduel. Ça pourrait être un peu plus sucré à mon goût. Somme toute une bière incroyable, le palais est bien rond, jen reboirais à chaque jour.

Trillium Mette. Ótima DIPA east coast. Very juicy! Ótima! Muito boa! Maravilha! 4.0/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had from a can, had it for a few months in the refrigerator but it held up well. Nice light IPA scent with a good IPA taste and no bad/strong aftertaste. Nice golden color with a bit of foam for the head, overall very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy golden yellow. Medium body. Hints of peach not overly bitter. Canned 2/22/17

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at slowrunner77s 
Pours hazy yellow with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and tangerines. Flavor is grassy, grapefruit and citrus zest 
Nice

January 2017 - Can share in Bayswater, with many thanks to Leighton. As Trillium Mettle. Hazy orange, translucent, still, foamy white head. Aroma is musty, tangerine, mixed citrus. Body is smooth with tingly carbonation. Taste is citrussy, lemongrass and straw, crisp spicy finish. Surprisingly restrained but also very nice. (4.0)

50cl can thanks to ciocanelu. Hazy golden pour with a tall white head. Notes of citrus, peaches, tropical fruit (papaya, pineapple, mango), honey, caramel, funky hops, a bit of dankness and light white grapes. Medium body and carbonation and just a hint of alcohol spiciness. Nice and juicy.

Really hazy bright yellow color with slightly off-white head. Aroma has a really soft hop profile, mostly grassy and herbal. Taste starts slightly sweet and juicy, some dank hoppy notes, finishes with a light to medium bitterness. Medium body, really smooth mouthfeel, well carbonated. Really nice NE style IPA, straight forward, well made, awesome.

Pours a cloudy, peach-yellow, with middling head. Aroma is very citrusy and hoppy-dank. Flavor is quite bitter, with loads of citrus and pine-spruce hops. Theres a slight touch of underlying sweetness to the whole combo. Very nice double IPA.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur orangée pâle trouble, mousse blanche persistante laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de houblon résineux, agrumes, pointe de cannabis, touche dalcool. Goût de houblon résineux, ananas, malt pâle, amertume contrôlée, juteux, agrumes. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-dense, texture ample.
16oz can pours a muddy gold with some clumpy, white head. Nose is grassy, lemon, lime, white grape, pine. Flavor is pine, grass, lime, lemon, some grapefruit. Full bodied and bitter finish. Solid.

Lightly hazed golden with nice white head. Clean dry, quite fruity-hoppy with some light pine notes. Nice floral fruit hop aroma. 

Notes: Can from the brewery in Boston, Dec 16...opened during the Patriots AFC championship game Jan 16; tastes like victory!
Thanks Carl!!! Nice NE IPA. Had the typically juicy aspects with more grape notes. Full bodied and well balanced. Yum.

50cl can taster thanks to Leighton. It pours a hazed pale yellow color with a medium white head. Aroma is lightly floral and sweet with notes of stone fruit and honey. Taste is also sweet and floral with some more stone fruit, honey and strawberry. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tasty but quite sweet

Bottle shared at Leightons place, 19/01/2017. Many thanks to Leighton for this one. A hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a lasting sticky white head. Aroma is nice dank hop, tropical hop, funky tangerine, orange, juicy. Flavour is composed of juicy straw, sticky hop, dank, tropical mango, peach sticky. Juicy. Palate is semi sweet, highish carbonation, juicy. Really good. Good.

Canned 12/21/16. Pours hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is mango, papaya, pine, semi dank, orange, citrus, little peppery, little spicy, white grape, really nice citrus notes pop. Flavor is super piney, bitter lemon rind, orange, citrus. Decently soft mouthfeel, especially as it warm. Nice, but a little too bitter for my taste.

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA,

APARIENCIA: de color amarillo, se observa turbia y una mediana actividad de carbonatación, también restos de sedimento, muy pocos pero ahí están. Corona de espuma color blanco de mediana retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas al centro.

AROMA: cítrica y frutal, dominan las notas a piña madura, mango, naranja madura, duraznos, toronja, algo herbal, como pasto recién cortado, un poco de pino y algo de dulzor de las maltas pero sólo para dar soporte a los lúpulos.

SABOR: de entrada una explosión de frutos tropicales y cítricos, piña madura, mango, duraznos, naranja, toronja, jugo de uva blanca, seguido del carácter herbal de los lúpulos, notas a pasto recién cortado, pino, algo especiado, y ligeramente las maltas, como la anterior, sólo para dar soporte a los lúpulos, el dulzor que aportan es mínimo. El retrogusto queda un amargor medio, con larga permanencia en la boca pero no es seco, queda el gusto herbal y ligeramente cítrico/frutal por mucho tiempo.

SENSANCIÓN: cuerpo medio con sensación oleosa en boca, mediana carbonatación.

RESUMEN: excelente IPA, de clase mundial.

475 ml can at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy yellow golden color with white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, grassy, floral, light pine, citrusy fruity, caramel, some tropical fruits. Sweet and bitter like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Big thanks to Maxbier for sharing this one. Poured from 16oz can. Pours hazy golden with some chunks floating in it and a white head. Aroma is potent dank hops, peaches, and citrus. Flavor is big fresh tangerines up front with fruity peaches and dank grassy hops. Big juicy grapefruit finish. Fantastic!

(16oz can) cloudyish gold, lasting fine white bubbles. Nose was initially a nasty aroma of onion which died over time, juicy, citrus peel. Taste of lime, citrus zest, juicy as hell, very well balanced, medium to light body, great juicy hop linger.

November 2016 release. Hazy gold/orange pour, huge head, rings of lace. Citrus zest, onion, grasssy aroma, mild pine notes. Citrus zest up front, slightly catty, mild onion note, pine, orange. Medium body, slick mouthfeel and a dry finish.

Can, pours a murky yellow golden with loads and loads of sediment chunks throughout. Small to medium white head. Notes of grapefruit and orange resin, heavy booze, and dark fruit. Hoppy but no balance whatsoever. Whack

Release du 11/30/2016 donc 4 jours de vie? Ok, belle robe dorée et mousse qui saccroche sans surprise. Nez Trillium, fruits et oignon, herbes et fleurs dalcool. Bouche huileuse sans grand mouvement des bulles. Saveurs fruitées intéressantes mais peu explosives, facture mielleuse, petite chaleur, pêche et conifères. Finale de houblons en sueur et cargaison herbacée.

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Can sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Fresh - few weeks old. Little shade of very hazy orange, no head. Nose is mellow onion hops & some zest. Body is restrained onion hops, white grape, orange peel, zest, nice dry grape, bit mellow shows some restarined. Nicely dry body, white grape & onion. Very thick hop feel. Very nice brew.
Hazy yellow orange pour with a bright white head. Aroma is citrus zest, pine, grass, and floral. Taste is orange, pine, floral, and grass. Medium soft body. Super easy drinking. Very good.

Poured from the can. Color is a deep hazy golden yellow. Floral aroma with grapefruit and pine. Well balanced double IPA with little malt background which I enjoyed. This is a smooth and easy to drink double IPA.

Loving the Columbus base on these citrusy hazy ipas. This one is very citrus forward, to the point I thought galaxy was involved. Pungent aroma and flavor, with a touch more bitterness and heat than the other trillium beers Ive had to date, but effin delicious and crushable anyway.

Aroma - has a big mix of hops - ranging from pungent, pine, and citrus (citrus qualities come of as: lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, and peach) and some caramel.
Appearance - the body is a nice hazed sunglow, with a 1 3/4" white head. The head fades into a small foam. Lacing develops.
Taste - has a mix of pungent, slightly pined, and citrus hops. The citrus quality is a mix of (grapefruit, peach, and lemon). There is also a slightly herbal and faint vegetal nature present. The underlying malt is of a caramel nature.
Palate - medium body, texture is velvety with some oil, the carbonation is average, and the finish is dry with some bitters and citrus.

Can. Hazy pale orange gold with lasting head and a little lace. Wicked grapefruity aroma. Grapefruity subtle tart sweetness with some grassiness and grapefruity finish. Surprisingly full creamy wheaty soft body. Tastes like fresh squeezed grapefruit juice, which I happen to like.

Can, by way of trade with jmbeergeek. Cheers Joe! Opaque, pale gold. Film of sticky, white head. Nose has super gluey, savoury, citrus hop. Its like pestle and mortar crushed hop leaf. Pineapple stalk and strawberry. Loads going on, and Im drinking it too fast to keep up. Taste is soft, juicy, grapefruit bitter. Super drinkable, despite the slightly weird savoury thing at the start. Never feels the ABV. Lovely.
Notes of apple and pear, slightly dank and moderately bitter. Malt and body lacking, especially for a DIPA. Different but not memorable.

Pours hazy glowing orangish yellow with thin white head. Smell is pine, hops, mango, tropical fruit and orange. Taste is bitter hops up front, tropical fruit, grapefruit, mango and orange. Medium body, heavy carb.
Thnx to Filip. Pours unclear blonde, small white head. Smell is bitter. Taste is full, peach, sweet, corny, juicy, full. Very Nice ! Perfect, aromatic aftertaste
Can thanks to Sherrie. Pours light clear yellow. Tropical and pine nose. Short bitter finish. Average carbonation.
Can thanks to Team North Jersey. Pours a cloudy orange gold with medium frothy white head. The aroma is grass and pineapple. Medium body, juicy, pine, grapefruit, dank, bitter finish, very nice.
Can shared at Piwoteka. Aroma is caramel, mango, some citrus fruits. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Flavor of citrus fruits, light hint of alcohol, pretty harsh mouthfeel.

Hazy golden pour with a creamy medium white head. Aroma has nice herbal pineapple notes. Flavor follows suit...ever so slightly boozy and minerally. Mouthfeel is light and creamy with a dry rindy/herbal/scalliony finish. Dig it.

Can. Thanks to Tommy for this. Apperance is cloudy yellow with an inch of white head. Aroma is peach, mango, pine, this is one juicy smelling beer. Taste is mango, pineapple, and bitter hop resin. Nice mouthfeel, with a juicy bitter finish. Abv is extremely well hidden, drinkability is off the charts, this is one dangerous DIPA.

Can pour at Augurs Well, courtesy of the lovely bartender, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out shitloads of tropical fruits, including papaya, guava and pineapple, with a big dank hop quality. Flavour bursts with tropical fruits, dank hops, and just enough sweet biscuity malt to back. Phenomenal depth and balance. Finishes juicy, dry and lightly bitter. Outstanding.

Fresh Can from the ft. Point brewery. Enjoyed from a snifter glass

Color: hazy, pours like grapefruit juice, light head
Aroma: floral, grass, citrus 
 
Explosion of hops on the tongue with a refreshingly smooth finish. A new favorite for me right up there with Heady & Pliny the Elder.

16oz can purchased at Trillium in Fort Point, MA. Pours golden orange, hazy with a slight foamy, off white head. Smells of citrus and strong hops coming through. Loads of citrus and hops. Grapefruit, orange and very nice dry bitter finish that cuts out perfectly. SUPERB mouthfeel. Smooth, creamy, full. Another beauty from Trillium.

At Trillium & Tree House tasting in Bruges, cheers Bart! Lightly lacing, moussy, more or less stable, egg-white head, cloudy yellow blonde robe with somewhat greenish hue. Aroma of yellow passion fruit lemonade, green banana, guava, smoky ripe papaja, green kiwi, soggy bread; vivid fruity flavour, yellow Zespri kiwi, nectarine, pineapple, passion fruit, sweetish with sourishness intermingled, softish carbo, lightly bready malt core, bit wheaty too (soapy), rich aromatic hop finish with hints of citrus peel and sweet exotic fruits like guava and mango, resinous bitterness but elegantly so, hint of gin-like, warming alcohol in the end, not interfering with the rest. Once again a beautiful Trillium masterpiece.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2016 Pours a slightly hazy orange/gold with a white head. Thankfully less hazy than everything else Ive been drinking. Nose is really juicy and bright, with a good dose of hops of course, tending toward the "dank" varietal. Big juicy mouth too, all kinds of fruit and hops. Quite a punch of alcohol too, which will keep the score down. Otherwise really good, just too much alcohol.
Bottle. Color hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma pine, citrus, peach, tangerines. Taste passion fruit, peach, caramel, tangerines, floral.
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and tropical. Taste is citrus, tropical, stone fruit, malt, and pine. Hides the alcohol well. Superb.
Shared at Hidden River. Turbid gold with white head. Huge hops, florals, pineapple, grapefruit in the nose. Very smooth, rich flavors of tropical fruit and floral hops. Delicious.

Thanks, floozbag. Can. The beer is fairly light in color. A milky, tannish yellow orange color. Clouded through, quite opaque. The head is medium sized and white. Decent retention with some lacing. The aroma is heavy on stone fruit hop flavors. Big apricot, plum, nectarine, peach. Some grapes. Lots of pineapple and tangerine holding everything up. Light malt sweetness. A little bit of pepper and onion. Light lime peel spice with a touch of grass. The taste is medium bitter and mildly dry. Some nice astringency to it. Solid mineral note. More oniony dankness to the taste. Soft, full mouthfeel. Long grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple and pine finish with more grass than expected. Somewhat juicy. Super easy to drink. Another excellent Trillium hoppy beer.

can offering recently picked up at brewery..dated 7.6.16..pours a hazy golden amber medium orange color..a few particles abound but not much..nose is great with all kinds of stellar white peaches and yes nectarines, just compared with a real nectarine and damn that is a nice aroma..mouthfeel is terrific with juicy goodness that is almost in the middle between orange/grapefruit juice/some white pepper n strawberry presence..quite easy to drink..full of goodness and doesnt drink like 8.4%..really enjoyable..very tasty double, another winner from Trillium, seek this out a great example of a New England double..
Can shared with Jaz from Andrew Harries; cloudy hazy light orange, aroma has dank pine and grapefruit, taste has sweet orange, light pine, spicy mango, delightful.

Bottle @ Home. Thanks to Peter. Milky orang beer with a white head. Dank on the nose. A lot of grapefruit, pine, and peach. Big orange marmalade as well. Theres a pretty zesty grapefruit flavor to this. I do definitely get some caramel malts and toasted nuts, which is not that great...but the hop profile is still quite nice and very citric and fruit forward.

Pours a murky golden colour with tiny white head that fades quick and leaves a little lacing. A huge tropical bomb on nose. Full of orange, passion fruit, mango and peach. Moreover, subtle grassy and dank profile. Taste is grapefruit and very light sweet malt finished with a gentle but long lasting pine bitterness. Medium mouthfeel and just perfect amount of carbonation.
Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Pours gold-orange and murky with a white head. Aroma of citrus and peach. Taste is citrus, peach, and very fruity with some floral notes.. Bitterness is moderate. Excellent.

Aroma: fresh with loads of citrus and some hops underneath; Appearance: hazy orange pour with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly; Taste: leads with bitterness that develops nicely on the palate; Overall: another delicious IPA from trillium without any green onion flavors.

Orange yellow with small white head. Aroma hops with tropical and floral scents. Medium body, lightly carbonated. Medium bitter flavor, citrus and grassy hops, orange, some malt balance. Flavor a tad less intense than aroma. Quite drinkable. Nice.

750ML bottle dated 05/05/16.

Pours a hazy yellowish color with a great aroma.

Great lacing around the glass and it goes down very easy for a 8.4% beer.

Worthy of its rating. Cant wait to have Heavy Mettle!

Flight at armsby abbey. Pours yellow with a white head. Leaves a shitload of lacing in the glass. Massive pine forest on the nose. Lots of pine on the tongue. It's bitter but well balanced. Finished clean. Very quaffable for the style. I quite like it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled on 4/1/2016. Batch 6 perhaps? Hazy orange yellow with thin off-white head. Aromas of big orange and grapefruit citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes, some toast and biscuit. Tastes of tropical fruit, citrus, some malt and biscuit, floral notes. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Great citrusy nose and taste.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a murky pale yellow with white head that quickly fades. Aroma is super fruity. Notes of passion fruit, papaya, guava, orange, pineapple. Taste is similar to the nose. Awesome tropical and citrus hop taste with caramel malt backbone. Wow. Awesome IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle into snifter showing practically opaque yellow with a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows light malts with a lot of cannabis. 

The palate is light bodied and medium carbonated. Flavors of dry pineapple resin and a light zestiness on the palate. Light bitterness on the finish.

May 28, 2016. Bottled May 5, 2016, courtesy _angst_, thanks! 
Cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is very fruity, slight floral with mango, pineapple, orange, some pine, grass and some dank notes. Taste is medium sweet, lots of sweet tropical fruits, soft bitter finish with grassy slight piney notes. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. 
Very good!

Bottle at Wailin Whales in Linus apartment 160528.Hazy golden beer with a nice off-white head. Hoppy pine aroma, citrus, peach, pine, caramel notes, tangerines, some floral notes. Hoppy passion fruit and peach flavor, mango, caramel, tangerines, floral, some pine apples, well hidden alcohol. Delicious DIPA.
A: Cloudy yellow coloured with a nice white head N: Pine, mango, passionfruit, papaya T: Mango, passionfruit, papaya, pine O: Amazing!!

Bottle courtesy of Håkan. Pours very hazy tiny burnt deep yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves some spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity, grassy and floral with crackers, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals, lemonz est and very subtle hints of alcohol. Taste is tiny sweet, bitter, fruity, grass and floral. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and bitter with unripe tropical fruits, grass and floral notes. As expected another great Trillium hoppy beer!

Cloudy yellow pour with a light golden hue and soapy white head and light lacing .... Aroma of peach, mango, grapefruit mosaic hops/citra and pineapple ... Rindy and earthy .... Taste is of earthy hops flavors, peach, grapefruit, pineapple, mango real harmony of citra mosaic hops .... Rindy and a very natural fruit coming out .... Finish is rindy and fruity with some light bitterness and lots of earthy fruit flavors .... Interesting stuff

Bottle of trillium tasting. The pour is a darker hazy light orange. The aroma is light hops, appleish. The taste is very nice, good mix of hops, full flavor, not bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a very hazy apricot puree amber with a large white head. Cool citrus on the nose, malt, soft biscuit, dry grapefruit peels. Medium bodied, big malt up front, warm alcohol, sweet and malty. Boozy, sticky, warm candied grapefruit, honeyed malt. Slow warmth on the finish, lingering gentle bitterness. Very malt forward overall, hop character was super subdued.

Murky hazy yellow orange in color... Aroma of grassy, herbal hops, some dank notes... Flavor is peachy, herbal hop notes throughout... Grassy hops on finish... Solid 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Slight haze to a gold pour. Small white head. Lacing. Danky. Hops. Hoppy taste. Thin dry. Slightly bitter. Very danky aftertaste.

750 ml bottle with no bottle date? No bottle date? Mass production... Yep. Thanks to Willrunforbeer on this gem. Grapefruit juice appearance, light bubbly head. Aroma is bold citrus, peach, tropical fruit and some mild grain. 
The citrus is bold with limes and hints of grapefruit upfront. The pine is here without ever really becoming resinous. Good amount of fruits and malts provide some balance. Texture is somewhat dry. Gosh damn, this is nice. Well beyond an average imperial IPA. Lovely!
750ml from Redstone. Pours orange gold with a white head. Aroma is nice, floral, melon, white grape. Nice flavor. Slight caramel, white grape, mild floral. Some grapefruit towards the finish.

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer nice grapefruit color with a thin white head. Aromas of grass rye malt spice citrus and hop. Taste is grassy hops grapefruit orange and a well balanced smooth finish. Wow. Nicely done.

Bottle courtesy of Cory. Pours a murky yellow with a thin white head. Nose is malt, rye, grass, spice, lemon, and peach. Flavor is similar with spice, malt, rye, spice, lemon, peach, and yeast. Medium in body and lingering grass and yeast.

750 ml bottle from the brewery, bottled on 4/1/16. Poured into a pint glass, hazy yellow with a very thin white head and moderate lacing. Grapefruit and grass aroma, some orange as well. Grassy hops and fruit provide a perfectly balanced taste, medium bodied, incredibly smooth finish for a double IPA. Really nice.

Fresh bottle straight from the brewery. This is seriously good -- it has all of the Trillium trademarks (soft mouthfeel, intense haze, English yeast flavor) but a gorgeous hop profile of bitter oranges. Outstanding stuff.

Bottle, kindly shared by Calum @Brew By Numbers. Thanks mate! 

Thanks Calum. Super resinous. Dry hopped to fuck. Super hazy. Super soft malts. Tastes like lemon Bon bons, casting sugar, mango, tutti-fruity. Nice balance. Really good dipa.

Cloudy yellow pour with white head. Im really having difficulty describing this beer. Its good but the Amarillo hops dont seem to have any distinct fruit or pine characteristics. Its tasty and well balanced with a good body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Hazy orange body. Smell is citrusy, Kinda herbal. Rye? Smells pretty sweet too. Taste is citrusy again. Sweet pale malt. A little of that rye flavor also. Medium heavy. Not really that interesting, but nice.
Bottle pour at post EBF tasting. Golden orange pour with white head. Herbal, grassy, citrus hop aromas. Flavors are herbal, grassy and citrus hops, booze notes are light.

Batch #5, about a month old. Cloudy orange with pretty heavy lacing. Nose is grapefruit pith and some dank hops, light minerality I have noticed in the Trillium brews. Taste is medium bitter, with some sweet biscuity malts, and a bitter finish. Juicy flavors of grapefruit rind, maybe white grape, some light honey.

APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, passionfruit, pine.
TASTE: hoppy,fruity, passionfruit, pine.

Dark, slightly murky orange, medium sized white head, nice soapy lacing. Grapefruit, peach, tropical notes, some grape, and slight vegetal dankness. Medium to full bodied, lively bitterness, fairly dry for the ABV, nice quenching finish.

Pours a really hazy golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of tropical fruits, slight onion, alcohol and pine. Taste is lightly sweet and moderately bitter. More tropical fruits, cereals. Alcohol is felt quite a bit but in a well integrated manner, never hot or harsh. Body is medium, carbonation moderately low and mouthfeel just smooth and silky. Solid! Happy Birthday to Me! ;)
Bottle - pours orange gold white head - nose and taste of orange peel, citrus and malt - med body
Lots of fresh tangerine and pineapple. Some peel and tangy passionfruit. Pours hazy orange with good head and lacing. Bitter finish with some tang. Bottle enjoyed on a balcony in Harar.

Bomber. hazy bright gold with a thick, foamy off white head that lasts in spots and laces. Aromas of peach, mango, pineapple, pine, yeast, straw, biscuit, light spice, floral notes and strawberry. Flavor is peach, mango, pineapple, pine, foral notes, yeast, biscuit, spice. Medium bodied, smooth and juicy with a dry, bitter end. Lingering tropical fruits.

31/XII/15 - 75cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: X/14/15 (2015-1836) Thanks to Thomas A. for sharing the bottle!
Clear deep blond beer, big creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, pineapple juice, bit spicy, grapefruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots and lots of pineapple, mango, citrus, soft bitterness. Aftertaste: quite some grapefruit, citrus, pretty bitter and dry finish. Another lovely one from Trillium!

Bottle from Clark. Dated 12/10/15. It pours a nice orange color with an off white head. The aroma has peach, orange and grapefruit with some light honey and dank. The flavor has a little more dank and hop spice along with orange, peach and mango. Pretty hefty body with some honeyed malts and sweet tropical fruit. Dank with some hop spice in a medium bitter finish. Kind of like their other hoppy beers only with a bit more body and honey sweetness. Another yum beer from Trillium.

Pours a hazy golden with 1 finger head and heavy lacing. Complex aroma of orange peel, lemon, grapefruit, tropical fruit and pine. Hint of toasted malt and bread, but very hop forward. Moderate to heavy mouthfeel. Long moderately bitter finish. This is impressive as always from Trillium.

Batch 5

Bottle share. Poured a golden orange, relatively clear, thick white foamy head. Aroma of citrus, pine, grass, and some grape notes. Flavor had grapefruit, orange, pine bite, and a bit of grape juice. Medium body with a sticky texture, solid carbonation, and a bitter finish. Trillium never disappoints.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2017 Bottle (750 ml). Split 4-ways. From Brian and thanks to JulienHuxley for the trade! Clear golden with a good white head, some retention, leaving some lacing. Aroma is of peaches, melons, tropical fruits and hints of alcohol. Taste is juicy and slightly boozy with loads of fruits (mostly melons and peaches), mild spiciness and moderate bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Oily mouthfeel. Juicy finish. Good fruity DIPA. Alcohol is present, but not too much and its rather easy drinking for the abv. Tasty stuff. 8-4-8-4-16 = 4.0
  
Update: Tried it again a few times and the best batches are easily a 4.2 with loads of fruitiness that balanced the alcohol really well for a high drinkability despite the high abv. Really good.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours blond/golden with high white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Awesome stuff. A chance we only had 750ml.

bottle shared by tom10101, many thanks! pours clear bright gold with a with a very nice white cap offering some retention and lacing. sweetish doughy melons, fruity garlic, juicy fruits, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; smooth and balanced citrusy finish. excellent double ipa.

Bottle shared. Almsot clear gold pour with thin lacy white head. Aroma is fruity, tons of melon, very fruity, peachy, light fruity tropical notes. Taste is fruity, very hoppy, light juiciness. Palate is mildly boozy, med-light bodied with good carbonation. Tasty stuff.

Hazu orange-ochre beer; almost no head but transparant ring. Catty hops, cats pee, valerian, citrus, rosewater. Again catty, but also cheesy hops, with a definite spicy tang that turns out almost pizza-like! Tangerine/mandarine peel. Again some sweet, rosewater-like undercurrent, certainly warming up. In time the spice turns more and more towards origan, making the pizza round. Medium bodied, bit thin for a double IPA. Not bad, very surprising again, but theres better around in this category.  Many thanks to Louis and Mathieu!
Lil Tuesday Tasting in Odense. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Big old-school hoppy aroma of grapefruit and lime peel. Dry and hoppy flavour with lots of grapefruit character. Delicious!

Pours a clear copper-gold color with a medium foamy white head that recedes gradually to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, floral hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of dank hops, tropical fruit and bready malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a fruity hops aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.
bottle thanks to Quag, this is incredible. Smells like a neck beard convention at Quincy Ma-ket. Tons of pineapple and tropical aromas, typical over tons of citra without that oniony flavor. Home run
From bottle. Pours hazy orange/amber with a white head. Aroma of tangerine, oranges, citrus, tropical. Taste is tropical, super tangerine, bitter finish, full body, lots of oranges.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma orange, juicy, pineapple, tropical, fresh. Taste is bitter, skunk, orange, tropical. Very nice
Bottle @ Rekvium, Orla and Dolles dødsyge søndagssmagning, 2015. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. Apricot, fresh cut grass and herbs. Lime and bread. Smooth and dry.

Bottled, shared by fellow Ratebeerians in the Beer Temple, Amsterdam (thanks guys!). Hazy golden colored. Fruity nose, lots of hops. Smooth bitter flavor, hops again, malts and yeast in the background. Balanced and easy to drink beer, well done.

Bottle, small sample. Hazy golden color, short head. Aroma is very fruity, slight grassy, bit pine, some orange. Soft bitterness. Not much cookie and biscuity malts. Tastes like a 6% beer. Not much residual sweetness most DIPAs suffer from. Great balance. Good beer.

750ml bottle (13 days after bottling!) from De Bierkoning @ Beer Temple, shared with Caesar, Benzai & Mr. Hangover. Hazy yellow golden color. Sticky white head. Aromas: hoppy sour, light malty sweetness, resin. Retronasal theres bitterness too. Flavor is light sour, moderate bitter, light sweet. Medium bodied. Long finish with lots of herbal hops, light to moderate bitter. Really nice.

Bottle shared. Hazy yellow to light orange color, medium to full sized white head. Aroma is lightly malts, hops. Taste malts, hops, fresh and crisp with a good bitterness. A bit thin texture though, medium carbonation.

Bottle thanks to FooFaa. Nose is super dank with star fruit, tangerine, light onion. Awesome. Cloudy orange. Medium white head. Great lacing. Taste is light vanilla and creamy with a string citrus orange. Tangerines. Fucken hell this is good. Moderate bitterness balances. Bright hops good

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours golden with a one finger foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, orange. Taste is more of the same, but a little boozy. Very dry, not sweet at all. Pretty tasty.

One of the better DIPAs ive had mainly because it tastes like a single IPA. Copper golden clear color with white head. Aroma is orange, mango, lemon, and light grassy. Taste is dry for the style with great juicy hops and minimal bitterness. Really drinkable dipa, great beer.

Bottle @ tasting. Pours a hazy, barnstone colored beer with a nice white head on top. Aroma is massive, depite this being an older sample. Loads of tropical fruits, grapefruits, fresh pine resin. Flavor is bitter, fruity, loads of tropical fruits with a faint boozy note in the very backend. Incredibly balanced, full bodied and long lasting aftertaste.

Bottle shared thanks to kermis, the milestones are getting closer tasting. Slightly hazy light golden with creamy and bubble white head. I smell massive fruity hops from a meter away, lets dig in... Pineapple, mango, massive mariuana, dank weeds, fresh cut grass, spring flowers. Light sweet malts and sugars underneath, but totally overpowered by the massive hops. Medium sweet and light bitterness. Almost full bodied with mouth coating velvety feel. Very nice and balanced, lovely stuff. Amazing mouthfeel.

Bottle shared at the Get Kermis to 8k tasting. Pours hazy golden orange with a medium white head. Aroma of soapy hops, tropical fruit, pine, resinous hops, citrus, orange peel, mango and light balanced caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with resinous hop coating the palate and very soft carbonation.

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Hoppy aroma. Medium creamy white head. hazy goldenn pour. Lovely hop character. Easy drinking despite the 8.4 abv. Well balanced. Excellent
My contribution to Sunday. Dank and overripe tropical fruit. A little fresher on the hops. Nice aroma. Good body and flavor. These guys are nailing their hops right now.

Poured from a batch 2 bottle. Thanks Floozy! 
Aroma is hops layered on top of more hops with a light cracker malt backbone. Lots of tropical fruit and citrus with a medium light dank, resinous note and light stone fruit. Orange, mandarin and tangerine with some pineapple and mango. Light peach and nectarine. 
Pours a hazy, dull, golden orange with a large, slightly off -white, thick, frothy head that exhibits nice retention as it slowly recedes. Medium high lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is slightly sweet with some cracker and biscuit notes as well as a hint of honey. Medium to medium high bitterness. A light mineral note from the water. Moderate hop flavors with quite a bit of citrus and lighter resin notes and tropical fruit. Hops arent as bright as in the aroma but quite a bit of orange and mandarin with some lighter grapefruit, pineapple and mango. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this beer smells amazing! The taste is really good too but not as much hop flavor as aroma. I like the malt backbone and the bitterness isnt harsh at all. Good water quality too!

Bottle. Pours hazy orange, large creamy white head, dissipates slowly with nice clumpy lacing. Aroma is very dank, juicy and tropical, pot notes along with pine resin and overripe mango. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter, juicy and hoppy, resinous and dank. Medium body with a hint of heat from the ABV. Nice DIPA>

750mL bottled 10/14/15, drunk 10/22/15.Typical Trillium pour as far as great head retention, but not cloudy/murky and while still hazy, not intensely so (and I only let this fridge for a week. This thing would probably have cleared after a month or so).The nose wasnt all that promising from the get-go, though with warming and breathing, it seems to improve a bit on account of the maltiness edging out some of the tangy, slightly aspirin-like hoppiness/acidity. Otherwise, tons of honey, light whitebread dough, lilacs, honeysuckles and tangy, overripe tangerines and overripe white grapefruit. Quite a good strength of aroma with no alcohol. Too bad about the slight aspirin notes....Although theres just a pinch of tangy, punchy hop in the flavor, its by and large beautifully balanced and free from any resin, heavy citrus or pine. Incredibly creamy, soft and tightly carbonated texture with some latent maltiness but still well-attenuated. Light meyer lemon, spiciness, herbs and just pure late hopping flavors of tropical fruits without any resulting resin/acid burn whatsoever. The aroma not quite up to par, and I think Upper Case was a bit more explosively juicy. But this is definitely more dry/drinkable than that one, so its very close in my book. Regardless, its still a world class double IPA and good to see some breweries still can make an elegant, restrained double IPA.
Gold pour, nice white head. Aroma of flowers, resin, orange rind and fruit. Flavor of resin, booze, quite bitter with a caramel and wheat backbone.

Bottle @ 5 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Thanks to Leighton for sharing this! Deep gold pour with a small head. Aroma is full of summery fruits and gentle citrus. Peaches, lemon peel. Taste is bright. Some dirty peach skin. Lemon lime. Slightly woody bitter hops on the finish. Soft body, chalky. Moderate carbonation. Great stuff.

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Big thanks to Leighton for hauling back more Trillium goodness. Lightly hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is crispy and semi dry. Smooth airy pale malts. Little creamy sweetness. Hops are spicy skunk with mild but bitter floralness. Trace of tropical fruits. Nice hop spice through the finish and well in to the aftertaste. Great beer to finish a great tasting!

Pours unclear syrupy amber with a brighter light sandy white head. Aroma is delicious sweet grapefruit with a pleasant but potent blend of three nice citrus and subtle piney hops. Flavor brings lemon curd on a full almost juicy body with a smooth bite of non spicy citrus hops.

Bottle (bottled six weeks ago). Pours a hazy yellow. Aroma is of ripe tropical fruit. The flavor is all hops to me -- not a bad thing at all. Flavor reflects the aroma, fruity with a medium, lasting bitterness. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle, crushed at the 5/7.5/10K - thanks to L-dawg, 30/12/14.
Hazed orange amber with a big old off white covering that retains well @looker.
Nose is big pine needle, bitter citric rinds, grapefruit, orange pith, straw.
Taste comprises tangerine, mandarin, big pine injection, fresh tropicana, straw, melon, grapefruit, citric pithdom.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness and pine linger in the close.
Top draw DIPA !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Dinged this beer four a couple reasons. One I am not a fan of these east coast IPAs that look like applesauce. Two the aroma was a bit subdued compared to Trillium's pale ale. Lastly after 2 sips I was out of my groove and knew I was going to have a headache. Not my favorite IPA 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours hazy golden with a thick off-white head. The nose is soft,sweet, juicy, peach, pineapple, passion fruit, apricot, sweet persimmon, freshly cut grass and wood. The taste is smooth, rich, soft fruits, bitter-sweet, orange, tangerine, grapefruit, straw, light sherbet, straw and toast with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Smooth, crushable and super-easy going. Brilliant balance. A joy to drink.

Bottle shared in London - picked up last week from the brewery. Pours cloudy gold with a frothy white head. Stunning nose, lots of dank hop, some pithy grapefruit, pale wood. Medium sweet flavor, buckets of juicy grapefruit, mellow rindy bitterness, rich pith. Medium to full bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with some resin, pithy grapefruit, jars of orange juice, lemon rind. Well balanced, thick and juicy. Gah, outrageous. Superlative beer.

Bottle from brewery. Pours a bright golden yellow with medium white head strong lacing. Aroma is lemon, peach, pineapple, dank resin, grass, citrus, faint caramel. Flavor is pineapple and mangos, light sweet, clean lasting bitter pine resin hop finish. Beautiful clean DIPA
750ml bottle pours a murky yellow brown color with a bit of head. Huge passion fruit atone when first opened. Mellow hop bitterness and lots of fruit. A great DIPA.
Woo-wee, this is hoppy. The citra gives the big citrus aroma while the amarillo comes in with spice (pine). Very tasty.

Pours deep gold into a snifter. Bright white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Resin and tropical fruit aromas. Soft with sweet caramel and resin upfront turning to dry mango before the lasting grapefruit pith finish.

Cloudy, pale yellow. Some fruity melon notes, citrus. Not terribly bitter, some sweetness. Medium body, fairly oily. Quite well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared by yourefragile. Thanks Michael!

The beer is bright golden with moderate haze and an inch or so of white head. The aroma...ooh la la! A tropical citrus and hop paradise. Simply perfect. I could smell this beer forever. The beer tastes pretty damn good too! This is a showcase for tropical fruit and hops. lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, mango, melon. So fresh and wonderful.
Draft at Lord Hobo, golden orange pour. Medium to fuller bodied. Big citrusy hops, great flavor, orange pith. Citrus zest, throat scratching bitterness. First trillium beer and its very impressive

32-ounce growler shared by cousin Peter, thank you! Sampled 3/23. Beautiful hazy gold, white bubbles, medium lacing. Aroma is massive and Heady Topper-like: aggressive dank resin and pine mixed with mango and tropical fruit. Some alcohol heat. Taste is great but doesnt measure up to the aroma: guava and lychee, orange, grapefruit peel, lots of sweet malt and lingering bitterness. Creamy. Bitterness and apparent alcohol keep this from being truly top-tier for me, but still an impressive showing that brings to mind the gods of Vermont.

Moderately hazy golden color; dense, frothy white head. Pineapple, citrus, floral notes, and a persistent herbal undertone. Medium sweetness rounded followed by orange peel bitterness. Smooth, lively carb, and medium-bodied. Fairly long bitter finish with some booziness.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2014 12 oz pour @ lord hobo. Trillium first anniversary beer. On for 1 day growler fills plus on tap at a few bars around town. First double IPA brewed by trillium. Go into thus brew in the biebers camp of "wouldnt this same beer be better if it had lower boost", but love a fair amount of trillium hopped brews and have surely had some great higher boost hopped brews from folks like hill farmstead.So excited to try this... also, Happy to try freshly tapped keg, as i can imagine this being a very delicate brew where time, air, shipping would not be kind.  

 Pours a big blonde peach hue with a big foamy long lasting head. Aroma of big potent juicy pineapple, grapefruit. Soft touch of lightly floral herbal catminte. Juicy passion fruit and orangepeel provide some pleasant tropical fruit balance. Hint of boost is noticeable, but enjoyed. Provides a fun extra dimension to the beer. Very light cateminte floral bitterness, bit in check for sure and enjoyed alongside the tropical fruitiness. Gonna say this is the best double IPA Ive ever had. Nice body. Pleasantly moderately dry. Lifts.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 On tap in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma strong of citrusy and fruity and floral hops, plus light, crisp malts and hints of wheat. Flavor the same with a great blend. Smoother, lighter texture. A great double IPA - reminiscent of that one brewery in Greensboro, VT.  EDIT: December 2015.  4.2 -> 3.7 What the hell trillium?  Remember when your beefs were good? This is not good.  Transparent, boring, not hoppy, not good.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 Pours a pale orange. Huge orange and creamsicle notes followed by pineapple.Starts sweet and finishes bitter.
